title: Barossa: Man slapped with huge fine for speeding
text:
A man in the Barossa Valley has lost his licence for six months after he was caught speeding at more than 50 km/h over the limit on Monday.

Police say he was clocked travelling at 134 km/h in an 80 km/h zone on Siegersdorf Rd in Dorrien just after 7pm.

The 55-year-old man from Greenock lost his licence on the spot and was slapped with a $1718 fine.

The incident has prompted police to warn the community of the dangers involved with speeding, saying in a statement that "speed is one of the major contributing factors in serious and fatal collisions".
description: A man has been issued a $1700 fine after he was caught speeding at more than 50 km/h over the limit in the Barossa Valley. Start your morning with our breaking news blog. Picture: File
